ACT
14.  
Second order intestate successors
Second order intestate successors are the parents of the bequeather and their descendants.
If at the time of opening of a succession both parents of the bequeather are alive, they succeed to the entire estate in equal shares.
If at the time of opening of a succession the father or mother of the bequeather is not alive, the descendants of the deceased parent replace him or her according to the provisions concerning first order successors.
If the deceased parent has no descendants, the other parent of the bequeather succeeds to the entire estate. If the other parent is also deceased, his or her descendants succeed according to the provisions concerning first order successors.
